newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Moslem group asks Clinton to end anti-Islam slurs.
newsitem.headline: Moslem group asks Clinton to end anti-Islam slurs.

text.p: The Islamic Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (ISESCO) called on Tuesday on U.S. President Bill Clinton to help end attacks on the Islamic religion in Palestinian territories.

"We urge President Clinton to take a resolute initiative with a view of stopping provocations targeting Islam notably the circulation of publications insulting to the messenger of God, Mohammed," the Rabat-based ISESCO said in a statement.
The statement was referring to posters put up by Jewish settlers in Hebron which inflamed Arab anger by depicting the Prophet Mohammad as a pig.
The group's head Abdullah Othman Altwaiji, who met Russia's ambassador in Rabat, also urged Moscow "to mobilise the international community with a view to halting provocations targeting Islam."

The posters -- pasted on June 27 across 20 storefronts on the Palestinian-ruled side of Hebron -- provoked an outpouring of Moslem ire and a surge in anti-Israeli protests in the volatile West Bank city.
ISESCO was created by the Islamic Conference Organisation to promote Islamic culture.
